channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump changes stance on Epstein files. And, the U.S. increases pressure on Venezuela
item.description: President Trump changes stance on the Epstein files, urging Republicans to support a House vote tomorrow. And, the U.S. military buildup in the Caribb...

item.title: Why some ant colonies get tricked into killing their own queens
item.description: For some would-be ant queens, the easiest way to take over a colony is to dupe its worker ants into committing regicide.

item.title: Ecuador rejects U.S. military bases in major defeat for President Noboa

item.title: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister sentenced to death for role in protest crackdown
item.description: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India an...

item.title: FEMA acting chief David Richardson departs after 6 months on the job, officials say
item.description: The acting chief of the Federal Emergency Management Agency has left his post, marking another disruption in a year of staff and policy changes. His l...

item.title: South Africa to refuse charter flights of Palestinians over fears of 'cleansing agenda'
item.description: Israel says South Africa had previously agreed to receive the 153 Palestinians who arrived last week.

item.title: More than 130 arrested in North Carolina as governor says immigration crackdown is ‘stoking fear’
item.description: U.S. immigration agents arrested more than 130 people in a weekend sweep through North Carolina’s largest city.

item.title: Homeland Security agents make arrest dozens in North Carolina’s largest city. Here’s what to know
Man accused of killing relatives of abandoned infant will seek change of venue
item.description: Austin Robert Drummond​ pleaded not guilty to charges including first-degree murder and aggravated kidnapping in the July 29 shootings.

item.title: EPA moves to limit scope of clean water law to reduce amount of wetlands it covers
Louvre closes gallery due to structural issue
item.description: The Campana Gallery, which host Greek ceramics, will remain closed as beams supporting the floor above are checked.

item.title: Lost Bach pieces performed for first time in 320 years
item.description: Germany's Culture Minister calls the discovery a "great moment for the world of music".

item.title: France investigating Vinted over alleged links to pornographic content
item.description: Some sellers were found to be luring viewers to their personal pages on adult platforms such as OnlyFans.

item.title: Ukraine to get up to 100 French-made Rafale fighter jets
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky hails a "historic" deal aimed at boosting Ukraine's defences against deadly Russian air attacks.
